text: "White Christmas" is a popular song about an old-fashioned Christmas setting. It mixes sadness and comforts of home. The version sung by Bing Crosby is said to be the world's best-selling single. The song has been covered and performed by artists including Jo Stafford, Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald and Bette Midler. It has sold over 150 million copies. The original version was released in 1942. Irving Berlin's opening verse is often dropped in many recordings. However, the opening verse is included on Barbra Streisand, Darlene Love and The Carpenters' Christmas studio albums. ==References== category:Christmas songs Category:1940s songs Category:Pop songs Category:Martina McBride songs Category:Frank Sinatra songs Category:Bette Midler songs Category:Westlife songs Category:Willie Nelson songs Category:Bing Crosby songs Category:Ella Fitzgerald songs Category:Michael Bubl√© songs Category:Pat Boone songs Category:Darlene Love songs Category:Jo Stafford songs Category:Martine McCutcheon songs Category:Jazz standards Category:1942 works
title: White Christmas (song)
